Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: MrsKellyPete
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a recent trip to Dallas. Everything was very nice (though the "fitness center" was two treadmills and a weight bench) and the breakfast was impressive. We slept well and had no trouble with the room, the staff, or the location.

Reviews.Title: “What's with the car fresher smell?”
Reviews.Author: Bmayes77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very run down and it's like they have air fresheners running through the AC vents... Makes us think that they're trying to cover up something?? The smell is too overwhelming!! It's as though they're updating because there are beautiful furnitures & fixtures, but tur walls, door frames, doors & carpet are in terrible shape so it almost seems like a waste? The walls are the thinnest that I have ever experienced... We heard every movement and voice in the hallway as well as every step taken in the room above us. The desk clerk was incredibly nice and accommodating. He went out of his way to make sure we were set up well.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Martin S
Reviews.Content: I found the room very clean and fresh, the bed was very comfortable! The evening social hour was a nice touch and the host, Stephanie was nice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Khatri4u
Reviews.Content: Great location and excellent service. I was there for 4 days . Had the best stay everyone at the hotel Was friendly specially stephanie during mangers reception.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than most HI express”
Reviews.Author: lcf-guy
Reviews.Content: The features & exterior look like most Holiday Inn Expresses, but my room was really run-down. The lamp was broken, the carpet the dirtiest I have ever seen, and the bath in need of renovation. On the plus side, it was only $75 and the location was convenient for me. WiFi was free and good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda462
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great "continental" breakfasts that include pancakes/hotcakes, scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, as well as the toast and cereal, muffins etc that are normally in a continental breakfast! Also, Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday evenings they had "social evenings" where they supplied, for free, finger foods like wings, ribs, fries and 2 "beverages"! The staff were really friendly, the rooms were very clean, the pool was a great place to cool off during the 106 F days! Also, the location is great, as it is just off of the LBJ Freeway. There are 6 good restaurants all within walking distance (Outback Steakhouse, Red Lobster, Olive Garden, Whiskers Catfish Buffet, Jack-in-the-Box, and our favorite - Cheddars, which is just out the back door of the hotel!) I would certainly stay there again if we were in Dallas! Also, the Allen Outlet mall was 15 minutes away! Cowboys Stadium (and Rangers Stadium) is about a 45 minute drive - Six Flags Amusement Park and Hurricane Harbor Waterpark are out by the Stadium as well.

Reviews.Title: “Our daughter's wedding guests stayed and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LSU1976
Reviews.Content: I called and blocked rooms for this hotel as it was centrally located for the events leading up to and the wedding of our daughter. We were given an excellent rate, all of the employees were nice and helpful, and our guests were comfortable and happy. Some of the guests used the pool and spa, and everyone enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. We will definitely stay here again when we visit Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Smell!”
Reviews.Author: 2manyhotelstays
Reviews.Content: Room had an awful musty smell as did most of the hallways. Fitness room is a joke - equipment is all in disrepair, temp set at 76 and tv is missing. Entire hotel feels damp, horrible humidity problem. AC in main lobby, hallways and elevators was broken when we checked in. I stay in hotels almost every week. This is one was by far one of the worst in ten years.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: mytrip063
Reviews.Content: I usually only think to write a review if I had a bad experience, to warn others. But I liked my stay at the Holiday Inn Express so much that I decided to write a positive review. The place succeeded on every level for me. The service was first-rate - every worker has a nice greeting for you. The rooms are nicely appointed, are very clean, and the beds were so comfortable. And the complimentary touches were great - a free american hot buffet breakfast awaits you when you get up - eggs, bacon, cereal, bagels, and fruit - and you even get free drinks at happy hour along with hot appetizers. The price was excellent. And the location was surrounded by major restuarant chains within walking distance , close to anything you'd need to get to. I would definitely come back. This was one of the best Holiday inn Express i had stayed in long time.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: gremlyn
Reviews.Content: This hotel ranks above many I've used in the past that cost far more. The place was convenient to everything (including our HQ). It was kept immaculately clean. The staff was outstanding to deal with. I felt like I was in a 5 star resort. My room was quiet and comfortable. The hotel even arranged to have us picked up by limo (on their dime) at our HQ since their shuttle stopped service at 6pm. And on the day we were leaving our Yellow Checker Shuttle never showed up to take us to the airport. On a last second request the manager allowed one of the staff to take us 17 miles to DFW without charge! We still tipped the driver well for saving our butts and getting us to DFW on time. I am having everyone in my agency stay there from now on. This is what service is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Non Smokers BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTraveler08
Reviews.Content: The hotel I am told had been renovated and it looked fine to me. The breakfast was also ok. The hot food was hot and the cold food was cold. It was a decent selection for that type of breakfast service and someone was on hand to keep it stocked and tidy. The room was clean and I had no problems with it. The couch in my room which was a suite was a bit outdated but not a problem for me. I did not have a problem with noise either. The MAIN problem was the STALE smell. Obviously there are smokers being allowed to smoke in the nonsmoking rooms and nothing is being done about it. Thist was clear once I stepped off the elevator. This was too bad. Get rid of the smell and people will come. For now, if you are not a smoker and cannot stand the smell....go somewhere else. IT is too strong to ignore.

Reviews.Title: “Rough Around the Edges”
Reviews.Author: doobious
Reviews.Content: For the most part, Holiday Inn Express is a pretty consistent chain, but this one seemed to be in the process of catching up to the rest. The breakfast room was under construction while I was there, but opened on the last day of my stay. The layout of the room was a little strange, the furniture was kind of old fashioned, but the beds were comfortable as always. Parking is also a little odd, everyone has to park behind the hotel since it also shares a lot with two other restaurants. All in all, a decent hotel, but I've had better.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Dallas Park Central Northeast
HotelInfo.Address: 9089 Vantage Point Dr., Dallas, TX 75243 (Formerly Hawthorn Suites)
